data.title: Village Board and Committee of the Whole Meetings
data.text:
Village Board Meetings

Held typically on the first and third* Tuesday of the month, Village Board Meetings are when the Mayor and Trustees take formal action (vote) on items presented for their review, via Ordinances and Resolutions.

Committee of the Whole (COW)

Held typically on the second Tuesday of the month, Committee of the Whole meetings are used to discuss a topic of interest in a public forum, allowing the Mayor, Trustees and the public to provide feedback and direction to Village staff.

*Beginning in 2024, the third Tuesday of the month is a hybrid Village Board and Committee of the Whole meeting.

General Meeting Information

Refer to the Village Meeting Calendar to confirm dates, times and location, as dates and times may change.

Agendas for meetings are posted a minimum of 48 hours in advance of the meeting. Find the upcoming and recent Village Board / COW meeting agendas and packets online through CivicPlus agenda software.

Minutes for past meetings are available in the online archive.

View live-stream and archived videos of Village Board and COW meetings online.

During standard Village Board and COW meetings, there is an opportunity for citizens to address the board on any item not on the agenda, under Citizens to Be Heard. Refer to the meeting's agenda for more details.
